Reviews.Title: “great location, reasonable price, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Lorie22
Reviews.Content: We had an exceptionally large, clean and nicely appointed room on the 6th floor, very quiet and with free wifi. This hotel is perfectly placed, right by Mitte underground station, and an easy walk to Museum Island and Potsdamerplatz. And at 80 euros per night for the double room, very reasonable. The staff were pleasant and helpful. We would definitely stay here again, but would probably have breakfast (not included) elsewhere - there is a Starbucks around the corner.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: Arlene O
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Kubrat Hotel from 29th October - 31st October 2011. Really enjoyed staying in this hotel. Excellent Location its literally round the corner from check point Charlie, hellium ballon ride and part of berlin wall. Staff are very friendly at reception, went to restaurant for dinner one night, had a lovely dinner and again staff were friendly. Hotel is very clean and its a warm comfortable environment. Enjoyed the fact that the room had a heater and also a fan. The mini bar was great and a selection of several drinks Great Value for Money Only little problem i had, i was away with my boyfriend for my birthday and i wanted a double room and we were given a twin room and was advised there was no double rooms left which was a dissapointment when i wrote this on request months ago when booking this hotel. Apart from that small problem, GREAT HOTEL, GREAT HOLIDAY, i would recomend this hotel Thanks for a great time

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money hotel choice!”
Reviews.Author: PSS123
Reviews.Content: The first and foremost, I would like to emphasize about this hotel is that it is settled in an excellent location (at the intersection of the Leipziger and Friedrich Strasse in Mitte district). This location is within 15-20 min. walking distance from several major tourist sites (Brandenburger Tor, Reichstag, Potsdamer Platz, just to name a few). It is well connected with the rest of the city, mainly through the U bahn network (Stadtmitte station is approx. 20 m from the hotel). On top of that, Friedrich Str. is a shopping mecca, with Galeries Lafayette and other stores, carrying all of the major fashion labels. Second important thing which I want to mention about this hotel is that, in my opinion, it provides excellent value for money relationship. We booked a double bedroom with breakfast included, and were really satisfied with this hotel. The room was huge, and I mean really huge (almost 50 square meters; I am guessing that this probably was an apartment building in the east Berlin later converted into a Hotel). The room was well furnished, a bit old-fashioned, but very nice and clean. Brakfast was a "standard", swedish-table kind, hotel breakfast, with selection of foods for everyone (vegetarians and not). The staff was very polite and helpful, fluid in English and French. Hotel lobby has free wireless internet access, which works flawlessly. The hotel rooms also have free wifi, but we, unfortunately, could'n make it work?! I would definitely, highly, recommend this hotel for the Berlin visit!

Reviews.Title: “Does not deserve 4 points rating”
Reviews.Author: stetir
Reviews.Content: Bad experience overall. Went there for conference. Location is central and convenient, and people at the reception were nice. This ends the positive things about the hotel. We stayed in the "Apartments", large suites in a separate buinding. First of all, there was no internet connection possiblity in the rooms, despite what was written on the website. Internet was free only in the lobby. Restaurant and breakfast were quite poor. The room (ground floor, Apt. 1) was VERY noisy, it`s right on the street and has also some noisy neighbors. I was waken up several times in the middle of the night. The room is somehow old, the bathroom had dirty spots (nothing big, to be fair) and some long-expired cookies were in the room fridge. The WORST thing was an itchy substance present in all linens. My skin was slightly itching evey day as soon as I walked in. My colleague had the same experience. Since I have no allergies, that must have been sone low-quality product used for cleaning. Overall everything seemed a bit run-down. It`s not very cheap, so I wouldn`t really go there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but they have to fix their wifi”
Reviews.Author: spanougakis
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, clean, but they must fix their free wifi, it is unacceptable for business use to be disconnected every now and then. Please offer free wifi without advertisements.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent .. in every way !!!”
Reviews.Author: akinahd
Reviews.Content: reception staff was very friendly & efficient. we were checked in very quickly. room was very large, clean and comfortable, with a small dining table. bathroom was very spacious and clean. even though the room was facing road, room was not noisy. breakfast was good with many choices. location was very convenient , which is close to the U bahn. few bus routes, which is linked to hot attractions are passing in front of the hotel. also there are few tourist hot spots in the vicinity, but i could not visit due to my pre-planned program.

Reviews.Title: “Central, but that´s it”
Reviews.Author: Tim_Norway
Reviews.Content: I didn´t expect to stay in a lavish location in central Berlin on my budget, but this was worse than expected. Booked an apartment to get a balcony and a bathtub, both wanted comforts that I don´t have at home. On arrival the apartment looked more like a closed down hospital. The rooms were huge, but insanely ugly decorated. Tasteless furniture, a so called kitchen with nothing,but a sink and a minibar. The bathtub could never be used expect for very very late at night or early early morning as there was no hot water. Reception´s response to the lack of hot water was that we should just let it run for a few minutes and it would be ok. After 30 minutes of letting the water run we finally gave up. No Wifi connection in the apartment building (not like it would have been much of an effort to set up a network there as well), the TV did not work even though we asked the reception on numerous occasions to look into it. The only response we got was the question: Is it plugged in, did you turn it on, etc. Promises were made that someone would look into it, but nothing more happened. The breakfast, which is not included in the price (costs 6,50 Euro extra) is not worth the price. You get a basic breakfast of boiled eggs, something that resembled scrambled eggs and on a couple of occasions cold coffee. Various hams and some cheese, cereal and fruit as well. The staff however was very nice and the pastry was freshly baked each morning. The location is very central though, a very short walk from Checkpoint Charlie, Brandenburger tor and the museums. The location is also very close to the U-Bahn. The staff was very helpful with locating things on the map, giving tips and advice. I would give the staff 5/5 if it wasn´t for the hot water and TV incidents. Do some more research and find another hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Helpful staff, great location”
Reviews.Author: like2trave0
Reviews.Content: Staff was very helpful. Room clean and very spacious. Great location, near 2 U-bahn stations (U2/U6) good connections to Tegel airport. But I would say skip the breakfast and take the room without paying for included breakfast. You can get much better just a few steps away for the same or less cost.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and confortable stay”
Reviews.Author: ynop
Reviews.Content: I stayed 5 nights in this hotel. The location is great, just in the city center. It is easy to take de U-Bahn or walk to many areas of the city. People are friendly and helpful. I got the chance to be upgraded in a suite as the rest was full (the suites are actually apartments)

Reviews.Title: “great, affordable option”
Reviews.Author: markusinmiami
Reviews.Content: Hotel Kubrat is perfectly located in Berlin-Mitte, with perfect U-Bahn connection in all directions. While the room decor is somewhat dated, the spaciousness, friendly service, great breakfast and free internet make more than enough up for it!

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't ask for more”
Reviews.Author: Goldig
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights here and were very pleased with everything. Front desk manager extremely helpful. Large room in main building as well as extremely large bathroom and everything cleaned every day. We had a rear room so no noise at all. Best part is it's location on U line 6 (easy in from Tegel airport with a short bus ride to the U-bahn 6 line at first) which crosses U-bahn 2 at the corner. Bus to Potsdamer Platz where one can change to bus to Hauptbahnhof passes the hotel. Easy access to Alexanderplatz by bus or U-bahn and a stone's throw to Check-point Charlie Museum. Oh yes, the breakfast was very good including sausages and eggs as well as cold items and fruit. The hotel is very plain but just perfect for sightseeing. The price of 99euros w/breakfast was really very reasonable. The 72 hour A/B zones travel card makes hopping on all means of transportaion within the city well worth it's purchase including getting in from the airport. Finding the office to buy the card at Tegel was the only challenge! There is so much to see in the new Berlin!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent staff, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lon39don39
Reviews.Content: We booked through the Hauptbahnhof infostore on arrival in Berlin and couldn't have been more pleased. The hotel is the former Bulgarian embassy guest quarters and still has wonderful elements of Soviet austerity in its design. We stayed in the suite block at the back of the hotel across a courtyard. The rooms were large, beds comfortable, bathroom spotless and the rate fantastic. You feel like you're staying in a real part of Berlin history. Breakfast was good. More importantly, you couldn't find more helpful staff than those at the Kubrat - incredibly attentive, courteous and thoughtful. The location is fantastic: two minutes walk from Checkpoint Charlie and the Gendarmenmarkt, 15 minutes to the Brandenburg Gate or the Museumsinsel. U-Bahn station Stadtmitte is 1 minute away and takes you to Prenzlauerberg in one direction and Schöneberg and Ku-Damm in the other. Bus M48 runs directly outside to Alexanderplatz. There are good upmarket restaurants in the Gendarmenmarkt and cheaper ones south of Checkpoint Charlie.

Reviews.Title: “Great location & great value”
Reviews.Author: Annie79
Reviews.Content: My husband and I and our 25-year-old son have just returned from a two-week stay at Hotel Kubrat. We were favourably impressed, and at 135 Euros a night it was excellent value. We had a 2-bedroom apartment in a separate building behind the main building and through a parking lot. The building was older, but perfectly clean and well kept. The apartment had IKEA-type furnishings. There were 2 bathrooms, one with just a toilet and sink, the other with a toilet, sink and bathtub with a hand-held shower, which we found a bit awkward. There was a large living room and a balcony. There was also a mini-bar fridge stocked with beer, water, wine, etc. that were reasonably priced, and the fridge was also large enough to hold items we purchased elsewhere. The included breakfast buffet was very good. The restaurant staff were always pleasant and smiling, as were the front desk staff. We found their English to be somewhat limited, but adequate (this is Germany after all!). We also appreciated the free internet in the stairway off the main lobby, and the fact that we could buy transit passes at the front desk and just charge it to our bill. The location was excellent, just steps from the Stadtmitte U-bahn station and within close walking distance of lots of restaurants and shopping. It was also within reasonable walking distance of many sites, including Museuminsel and Potsdamer Platz. The only inconvenience with this hotel was the fact that they would only give us one key for the apartment, and with 3 adults, we were not always coming and going at the same time. However, this problem was manageable with some advance planning.

Reviews.Title: “Great appartment - perfect location”
Reviews.Author: gin76
Reviews.Content: Our family of three adults stayed at Kubrat for two nights in august 07. We made our reservation through the tourist information office at the Brandenburg Gate. We got appartment no 6 in a building just through the backyard parking place (€ 6/day). The appartment was huge - two big bedrooms, a large livingroom with a nice balcony, a bathroom with toilet, and another separate wc, and a kitchen with fridge and a sink. Though the appartment could need some new carpeting and some paintwork, it was perfect for our stay. The location is great. Approx. 50 m from Checkpoint Charlie, and with Potsdamer Platz, Unter den Linden, Brandenburg Gate and Reichstag within a distance of 800 m, the Kubrat Hotel is the perfect starting point for a Berlin experience. The staff was very nice and polite, and we got warm smiles from both the reception staff and the lovely breakfast-fraulein. Not all of them are very good in English, but with a little German and a little English, it's OK. Breakfast is also OK, but could be better. All in all, though, the Kubrat Hotel is great value.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: travellady83
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel through tripadvisor and was very pleased with my stay. Not enough can be said about the helpful staff at the front desk. At the end of my stay, they even called ahead to my next hotel to be sure that my reservation was confirmed. The location cannot be beat. You are within walking distance to all the sights and museums. The hotel does need to replace worn towels, sheets, bedspreads, and carpeting. It would make a difference in its appearance. While in Berlin I took 4 of the Original Insider Tours. They were superb and gave you great value for your dollar. You can find brochures for the tours in this hotel's lobby.

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant stay at the Hotel Kubrat”
Reviews.Author: SilverPearl
Reviews.Content: This hotel equipped with an elevator is located conveniently near the Potsdamer Platz train station. Though it is located along a busy street, our large, clean room in contrast was very quiet. English-speaking staff members were pleasant and helpful. The continental breakfast was great, and an adjacent Italian restaurant served good food. The hotel provided free use of the Internet on a computer outside the lobby. The Checkpoint Charlie Museum, Brandenburg Gate, Reichstag and Holocaust Memorial are within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Consider Hotel Kubrat”
Reviews.Author: KY_Traveller
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent seven days at the Hotel Kubrat and were very satisfied. The room was large and comfortable. The shower was in one room, the toilet and sink in another. Both of these rooms were separated by a door from the rest of the room where the beds and a sitting area were located. Even though our room faced busy Leipziger Strasse, the street noise seldom bothered us. The included breakfast was varied, although it never changed from day to day. The reception desk was staffed 24 hours a day, and they were very courteous. Since their English was far better than my limited German, we never had problems communicating. In spite of the fact that the other hotel guests were German, we always felt like we fit in with the crowd. The location, near the Stadtmitte U-bahn, was very convenient and within walking distance of the Gendarmenmarkt area. The next cross street from the hotel is Friedrichstrasse whose shopping opportunities reminded us of Michigan Ave. in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “clean, big rooms”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I had been in this hotel for one night for business purpose. The receptionist was very polite and first paid for us the taxi driver fee, since we didn't have small money. The room was very big and so is the bathroom (its has only shower, and no bath tub). The room was very clean and quiet. Breakfast was fine, though the milk was a bit sour. The location is also very good and near a "U" train station.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Kubrat Berlin Mitte
HotelInfo.Address: Leipziger Strasse 21, 10117 Berlin, Germany
